alt_text: A technical cross-section schematic of Hexenon-X ballistic armor plating, illustrating the 'Hybrid-Ply' layering strategy used for Level IV threat protection.
ocr_text: LAYER 1: STRIKE FACE (5mm HEXENON-X). LAYER 2: CERAMIC MATRIX CORE (10mm). LAYER 3: STRUCTURAL BACKING (3mm HEXENON-X). KINETIC ENERGY INGRESS. MOLECULAR DISPERSION PATHS. THERMAL CONVERSION ZONE.

visual_elements.label: Impact Strike Face
visual_elements.description: The outermost 5mm Hexenon-X layer where initial molecular dispersion occurs, characterized by a tight honeycomb lattice.

visual_elements.label: Energy Dispersion Vectors
visual_elements.description: Red arrows originating from the impact point that spread horizontally across the weave, illustrating the conversion of kinetic force into thermal energy.

visual_elements.label: Ceramic Matrix
visual_elements.description: The central 10mm core designed to capture projectile fragments after the initial Hexenon-X strike face has reduced the velocity.

visual_elements.label: Structural Back-Plate
visual_elements.description: The innermost 3mm layer of Hexenon-X that prevents back-face deformation and maintains the structural integrity of the vehicle or vest.
